FuncDef:
The radius-attribute qos-profile no-exist-policy command configures a policy whether to allow users to keep online when the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured on the .
undo radius-attribute qos-profile no-exist-policy command restores the default configuration.
By default, if the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured on the , users are logged out.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a policy to allow users to keep online when the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured on the .
-

Specifies a policy to log out users when the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured on the .
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To change the control policy for users when the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured or not supported on the device, you can run the radius-attribute qos-profile no-exist-policy command.
Configuration Impact
If the radius-attribute qos-profile no-exist-policy online command is run, users keep online when the QoS profile delivered by the RADIUS server is not configured on the device. The rate of user traffic is restricted based on the QoS profile configured in a domain or on an interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
